title: Here we go again... [Client]
body: Oh boy. I finally get around to updating my drivers and fixing my FPS and ping and my computer still being a toaster, I boot up League, and press "Launch Legacy Client," The Beta client closes as it should and then I see the old League Of Legends emblem/kernel and then all of a sudden, "Nope." "Pvp.net patcher kernel has stopped working" Something along the lines of that. So.......... Wat do.

replies.body:
The kernel error is usually caused by a security issue blocking it game from loading.  You'll want to use [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to fix this up.  You can also return to the legacy client another way:

-  Create a shortcut directly to the legacy client in your League Installation. Just look for "lol.launcher"

I hope that helps!

The shortcut doesn't work but fortunately the permissions tips helped so I just launched Beta as admin and clicked Legacy and it worked.
So it's just a little out of my way.
